metadata.Title: CVE-2020-14309 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.Description:
There's an issue with grub2 in all versions before 2.06 when handlingsquashfs filesystems containing a symbolic link with name length of UINT32bytes in size. The name size leads to an arithmetic overflow leading to azero-size allocation further causing a heap-based buffer overflow withattacker controlled data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14309` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-common - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-coreboot - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-coreboot-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-amd64-signed-template - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm64-signed-template - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-ia32 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-ia32-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-riscv64 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-riscv64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-emu - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-firmware-qemu - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-ieee1275 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-ieee1275-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-linuxbios - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-pc - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-pc-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-rescue-pc - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-theme-starfield - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-uboot - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-uboot-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-xen - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-xen-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-xen-host - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub2 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub2-common - 2.06-2ubuntu7
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64-signed - 1.182~22.04.1+2.06-2ubuntu10
grub-efi-arm64-signed - 1.182~22.04.1+2.06-2ubuntu10
No subscription required

grub-efi-amd64 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-amd64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm64 - 2.06-2ubuntu7
grub-efi-arm64-bin - 2.06-2ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: grub2 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.06-2ubuntu7').
grub2-signed package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.182~22.04.1').
grub2-unsigned package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.06-2ubuntu7').
